Olivier became involved with venture capital in 1988 following a career as an engineer in large export projects (Sofretu then the Schneider Group).

From 2000 until 2005, Olivier was at the Caisse des DÃ©pÃ´ts Group, Executive Director of CDC Entreprises FP-Gestion, in charge of the Fonds Public pour le capital risque and the Fonds de promotion pour le capital risque.

Previously, he succesively led SNVB Participations (CIC Group), BTP Capital, the investment of CrÃ©dit du Nord and private equity with SociÃ©tÃ© GÃ©nÃ©rale.

Since the beginning of the 90’s, Olivier took an active interest in the investment sectors of the Demeter fund.

He directed, for 5 years, the BTP Capital fund, which he specialized in the eco-industries with excellent results.His track-record (about 50 investments with an overall gross IRR of 22.6%) shows a dozen successes in this sector.

At the AFIC (Association FranÃ§aise des Investissements en Capital / French Private Equity Association), Olivier is Vice - Chairman of the training committee and a member of the ethics committee.

Olivier Dupont is the author of two books: “Les PME et le marchÃ© de l’environnement” (1995) and “Ajustement de prix et capital investissement” (2002).
